thread.title: Arnold Schwarzenegger compares Nickelback to U.S. Congress and herpes, Nickelback fights back | National Post
thread.title_full: Arnold Schwarzenegger compares Nickelback to U.S. Congress and herpes, Nickelback fights back | National Post

author: Sadaf Ahsan
title: Arnold Schwarzenegger compares Nickelback to U.S. Congress and herpes, Nickelback fights back | National Post
text:
FarkIt 
It isn’t easy being Nickelback. 
As one of the most hated bands of all time, the Canadian group have taken yet another hit, this time from former California governor and current Apprentice host Arnold Schwarzenegger. 
Choosing to take a swipe on Valentine’s Day of all days, Schwarzenegger compared the musicians to the unpopular U.S. Congress — and herpes. 
He tweeted, “When Congress is less popular than herpes & Nickelback, how do 97% of them get re-elected? Gerrymandering.” 
Not taking this one lying down, the band swiftly responded, slamming Schwarzenegger where it hurts most — his role as Mr. Freeze in the 1993 tanker Batman & Robin. . @Schwarzenegger big fans. Approval rate this: Batman & Robin. Please leave us out of your future wisdom drops. Danke Shön Herr Governator. 
— Nickelback (@Nickelback) February 14, 2017 
They tweeted, “big fans. Approval rate this: Batman & Robin. Please leave us out of your future wisdom drops. Danke Shön Herr Governator.” 
The two cleaned it up in the end, though, with Schwarzenegger acknowledging the swipe and, possibly forgetting Nickelback is very much Canadian, tweeting, “That’s… ice cold. I hope we can agree that we need a freeze on gerrymandering, guys. Thanks for the reply.”
